Tan See Leng (born 24 December 1964)[1] is a Singaporean politician  business executive  medical practitioner and entrepreneur. A member of the governing party People's Action Party  he was appointed as the Minister in the Prime Minister's Office  Second Minister for Manpower and Second Minister for Trade and Industry by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong.
In 2019  he retired from the position of group CEO and Managing Director (MD) of Parkway Holdings and Parkway Pantai Limited.[11]

Traders Lost $ 3.7 billion amid falling BitcoinüìåAgainst the background of the fall in the bitcoin rate to a local minimum of $ 48.4 thousand  crypto exchange users lost $ 3.7 billion  according to the bybt service.In total  positions of almost 600 thousand traders were closed  one of them lost $ 11.3 million.üìåMost of all  losses on positions in pairs with bitcoin amounted to $ 1.3 billion.On transactions with Ethereum  losses amounted to $ 652 million  with XRP - 394 million. 85% of positions closed over the past day were long. This means that traders expected further growth in quotes.üìåThe fall in the crypto market happened against the backdrop of a decline in the stock market.Yesterday  the Dow Jones Index fell 0.9%  the S & P500 - 0.8%  the Nasdaq Composite - 0.7%.This happened after the information appeared that the United States plans to almost double the capital gains tax for the rich.Bitcoin Economics
